STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR LANSING DIRECTOR
November 21, 2022
Darnell Britt
Community Care Organization
18688 Joann
Detroit, MI 48205
RE: License #: CB820315857
Investigation #: 2022C0420027
Community Care Organization
Dear Mr. Britt:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 860-0787.
P.O. BOX 30664 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • 517-335-1980

Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3317
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Youth A went AWOL on 8/24/2022, and the facility failed to notify Yes
Youth A’s parent.
Additional Findings No
III. METHODOLOGY

2022C0420027

Spoke with Complainant

Left message for Parent B

Email to agency CA 1 and Administrator 2 RE: the
complaint/allegation
09/26/2022 Contact - Document Received
Email from Administrator 2 in reply to my 9/20/222 email
09/26/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Spoke with Administrator 2 Re complaint and site visit
09/26/2022 Contact - Document Sent
Email to Administrator 2 confirming date of visit
09/26/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Attempted contact with Parent B- left another message
09/26/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
to number reported for Youth A- indicated not available- left
message
09/30/2022 Contact - Face to Face
Onsite Agency visit. Interviewed Administrator 2 and Case Worker
3, reviewed youth hard file
10/03/2022 Contact- Telephone call
Attempted contact with Case Worker 4. Number not in service
(tried with two different area codes)
10/03/2022 Contact- Document Sent
To and from Administrator 2 Re: contact number for Case Worker
4- Administrator 2 indicated that is the only number of record for
Case Worker 4
10/03/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
And Received from Parent B- Spoke with Parent B
10/03/2022 Contact - Document Received
Text message from Parent B
10/03/2022 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
10/17/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Preliminary Exit with Administrator 2
2

ALLEGATION:
Youth A went AWOL on 8/24/2022, and the facility failed to notify Youth A’s parent.
INVESTIGATION:
On 9/20/2022 I spoke with the Complainant X by telephone. Complainant X
reported Youth A had been in independent living placement with the Community
Care Organization (CCO) agency; and he apparently went AWOL from his
placement in. Complainant X said Youth A’s mother, Parent B contacted her on
9/9/2022; and Youth A called her on 9/19/2022. Parent B asked her why no one had
contacted her about Youth A’s AWOL. Parent B reported getting a call from Youth A
earlier that he was out of state. Parent B did not say exactly when it was that Youth
A had called her or where Youth A was located. Youth A affirmed to Complainant X
he had left his placement. He reported wanting to enroll in school and Parent B had
suggested he call Complainant X. Complainant X surmised Parent B and Youth A
reached out to her because she had investigated a matter related to Youth A back in
April of this year. Complainant X is not Youth A’s DHHS (Department of Health and
Human Services) worker or monitor.
On 9/30/2022 during an onsite CCO agency visit, I interviewed Administrator 2 and
Case Worker 3. Administrator 2 reported they did not contact a parent related to
Youth A’s AWOL.
• Administrator 2 reported she did not contact Youth A’s mother related to his
AWOL because she did not have contact information for Parent B. She
reported Parent B was not involved in Youth A’s case at court. Additionally,
that Parent B’s contact information was not indicated in MISACWIS.
Administrator 2 reported Case Worker 4 gave approval for Youth A to have a
weekend pass on 8/19/2022 with his brother unbeknownst to her. Youth A
was to return 8/21/2022; and on 8/22/2022, he was technically AWOL
because he did not return to the facility by 9:00pm. Administrator 2 reported
discovering after the fact that Youth A had apparently planned not to return to
the independently living home/he AWOLed because he had taken all of his
belongings. She reported that after Youth A’s AWOL, Case Worker 4 was
putting forth efforts needed to conduct a search for Youth A. Administrator 2
reported contacting the DHHS monitor on 8/23/2022 and provided me an
email showing such. She reported after a call from Parent B on 9/9/2022 they
were leaving messages at the number Parent B called from but received no
response back. Administrator 2 suspected that Youth A was with Parent B
because August 24th is Parent B’s birthday. On 9/19/2022 the agency
received a contact from children services that Parent B had called to say
Youth A called her and reported that he was AWOLed. Parent B had also
reported that no one contacted her. Administrator 2 reported that on
9/20/2022 Parent B contacted the agency, reportedly from a different number,
reporting she was Youth A’s mother, not the grandmother; as she had
previously alleged.
3

It is notable, the number Administrator 2 reported Parent B called them from,
and that they contacted Parent B at after 9/9/2022 is the same number listed
as the contact number for Parent B in MISACWIS. It is also the number I left
messages for Parent B at and from which Parent B contacted me from.
• Case Worker 3 reported she was on medical leave from 7/5/2022 until
9/9/2022. She reported that Case Worker 4 was responsible for Youth A’s
case during her leave time, and when Youth A AWOLed at the end of August.
Case Worker 3 reported receiving a call from Parent B on 9/9/2022, but at
that time Parent B presented herself as Youth A’s grandmother. Case
Worker 3 reported the agency tried to hold Youth A’s bed/placement after he
AWOLed. Administrator 2 was trying to work that out with Youth A’s DHHS
monitor.
On 10/3/2022 I interviewed Parent B by telephone. Parent B denied receiving a
contact from the agency related to Youth A’s August 2022 AWOL. She also denied
contacting the agency pretending to be Youth A’s grandmother or anyone other than
herself. She further denied Youth A being with her on her birthday. Not that she
knew he had AWOLed at that time. She reported receiving the first call from Youth A
on 9/3/2022 when he asked her to come pick him up from Indiana. Youth A reported
getting to Indiana by way of a bus pass from the agency, which the Case Worker 3
denied would be something the agency would provide to a youth. Parent B reported
picking Youth A up on 9/4/2022, but not reporting that to the agency. She reported
after Youth A was with her on 9/4/2022 she was contacting the agency. Youth A was
picked up by someone as she trying to report his whereabouts; Youth A had left.
Reviewed
Youth A’s case record which showed:
• He is a temporary court ward.
• He was placed with the agency from 4/8/2022 until 8/22/2022. He resided at
the agency’s Joanna Street independent living house in Detroit.
• Different action summaries completed related to Youth A’s termination from
the program.
• Bed hold payment request form beginning 8/22/2022-9/18/2022.
APPLICABLE RULE
722-03 A Absence Without Legal Permission (AWOL)
Within 24 hours
Within 24 hours of the child’s absence, the supervising agency
must notify:
• The parents, if appropriate.
4

ANALYSIS: The agency did not notify Youth A’s parent he had AWOLed and
was missing from placement.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan continuation of the agency’s
current licensing status is recommended.
________________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date November 10, 2022
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 21, 2022
________________________________________
Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
5
